intro: Salsola fruticosa, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and coastal areas. The plant has small, spiny leaves and produces clusters of tiny, greenish flowers that are often wind-pollinated. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing it to spread rapidly in disturbed soils. Salsola fruticosa is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural and urban landscapes.
